Starting a new comment thread related to the seg-fault with `World::BuildSceneMsg` and `World::RemoveModel` mentioned above ([see backtrace](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/f24902f8b7bbeccf6e61)).

`World::BuildSceneMessage` is called during `World::ProcessMessages`, which is called at the [end of a World step](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/d354cc789932049c9d07e3d7865fade7992d7e6b/gazebo/physics/World.cc#cl-586). `World::BuildSceneMessage` is calling `Model::FillMsg` on each model.

Meanwhile, `World::RemoveModel` is calling `Entity::RemoveChild` on a specific model. It [locks the PhysicsUpdateMutex](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/d354cc789932049c9d07e3d7865fade7992d7e6b/gazebo/physics/World.cc#cl-2030), but that does not protect `World::ProcessMessages`. Perhaps `World::RemoveModel` also needs to lock `World::receiveMutex`?
